LanguageData.BandwidthGizmoTip: An overseer can only oversee a servitor if there is enough bandwidth to do so. Each servitor consumes a different amount of bandwidth.\n\nGain more bandwidth by constructing band nodes and tuning the overseer to them, or by equipping special overseer apparel.
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerDesc:
One or more of your servitors is not controlled. Connect your servitors to an overseer with sufficient bandwidth to control them.

If left uncontrolled for more than a day, a servitor could go feral. When this happens they will join {0} and become hostile to you. If one servitor goes feral, it will bring other nearby servitors with it.

Feral servitors cannot be restored at a servitor construction bay when killed.
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerMayGoFeral: The following servitors are uncontrolled and could go feral at any moment
LanguageData.MechbandAntenna: Band nodes must be tuned to a specific overseer. This will add 1 bandwidth to that overseer's total bandwidth, allowing them to control more servitors.\n\nOnce a band node is constructed, it can be quickly tuned to an overseer. However, retuning a band node to a different overseer takes significantly longer.
LanguageData.MechlinkBasic: A simple head-mounted comms computer that slightly enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows them to control more servitors.
LanguageData.MechlinkStandard: A head-mounted computer and signaling array that enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows them to control more servitors.
LanguageData.MechlinkAdvanced: An advanced head-mounted computer and signaling array that dramatically enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows the wearer to control many more servitors at once.
LanguageData.Apparel_MechlordHelmet: A heavy plasteel-weave helmet packed with overseer-assistance gear. The overseer helmet dramatically amplifies an overseer's bandwidth, but is somewhat less protective than dedicated heavy armor.
LanguageData.BandNodeTuningDesc: Tune this band node to an overseer. Tuning will take {0} to complete.
LanguageData.BandNodeRetuningDesc: Retune this band node to another overseer. Retuning will take {0} to complete.
LanguageData.DropThingBandwidthApparel: Removing {0} will change {1_labelShort}'s bandwidth from {2} to {3}. This will mean the following servitors will no longer be under control
LanguageData.MechCarrierDesc: Release a swarm of up to {0} {1}. Each {2} costs {3} {4} to build. If the parent is destroyed then all the linked {1} will die. {1} cannot be recharged and will die once their power source runs out.
LanguageData.MechPowerCellTip: War urchins have a one-time power source. When the power cell runs out, the servitor dies.
LanguageData.RemoteMechShieldTip: A remote shield projected by an overseer. It will attempt to stop incoming projectiles or shrapnel, but does nothing against melee attacks or heat. It prevents the wearer from firing out, and shuts down instantly if hit by EMP
LanguageData.AlertWarqueenHasLowResourcesDesc: One or more {0} are low on resources. They will be unable to produce servitors on command if they run out of resources.
LanguageData.AlertRechargerFullDesc: Some servitor recharger(s) are storing their maximum number of toxic wastepacks. Servitors can't use these chargers until the toxic wastepacks are hauled away.\n\nSelect a colonist and right-click a recharger to unload it.
LanguageData.AlertNeedMechChargersDesc:
You don't have rechargers for all your servitors. If a servitor runs out of energy, it will fall into a dormant self-charging state and will recharge very slowly.

Build more of the following chargers:
{0}

Note: Only light servitors can use regular servitor rechargers. Medium or heavier servitors require large servitor rechargers.
LanguageData.AlertMechMissingBodyPartDesc: One or more of your servitors are missing a body part. An overseer can repair lost parts.\n\nThe servitors with lost body parts are
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDescPrefix: These servitors are damaged and need repair
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDesc: Order an overseer to repair them, or select the servitor and turn on auto-repair. Repairing a servitor requires energy. If a servitor's energy is so low it can't move, someone must carry it to a recharger.
LanguageData.AlertBossgroupIncomingDesc: Signaled by your overseer, a hostile {0} is approaching with its combat escort. Be prepared, this won't be an easy fight. The hostile servitors will arrive in a few hours or days.
LanguageData.CommandSelectAllMechsDesc: Select all servitors controlled by this overseer.
LanguageData.CommandCallBossgroupDesc:
Signal an enemy Necron commander along with its escorts using forbidden binharic protocols.

If you defeat the commander, it will drop a special cogitator chip which you can use to advance your own cybernetica technology.

There are three commander types, each signaled a different way, each dropping a different type of cogitator chip.
LanguageData.CommandSelectOverseerDesc: Select the overseer who commands this servitor.
LanguageData.CommandAutoRepairDesc: If active, an overseer will automatically repair this servitor. Repairing a servitor drains its energy.
LanguageData.ConfirmInstallMechlink_Smithing: An overseer must be capable of smithing to create servitors.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.ConfirmInstallMechlink_Intellectual: An overseer must be capable of intellectual tasks to unlock cybernetica research.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.MechanitorLeftMapWithoutMechs:
The following servitors have been left behind by {PAWN_labelShort}:

{MECHS}

The servitors will stay here until they are picked up.

Would you like to set their work mode to escort so they follow {PAWN_labelShort} off the map?
LanguageData.CaravanLacksMechMechanitorWarning: Your caravan contains a servitor but not their overseer. You will have limited control over the servitor when you reach your destination.
LanguageData.MechWorkActivitiesExplanation: The work activities that can be performed by this servitor.\n\nThe following list details which work activities can be done within each work type
LanguageData.MechRechargeSettingsExplanation: Change when servitors will start and stop charging.\n\nServitors with energy below this range will automatically seek out a recharger. They will stop charging once they reach the top of this range. These settings only apply in work mode.
LanguageData.MechWorkSkillDesc: The skill level that this servitor acts with.
LanguageData.MessageMechanitorCasketOpened: {0} was an overseer. You can remove {0_possessive} {1_label} and use it on a colonist.
LanguageData.MessageMechanitorLostControlOfMech: {0_nameDef} has lost control of a {1_kindBase} servitor
LanguageData.MessageMechChargerDestroyedMechGoesBerse: A servitor recharger was destroyed while {PAWN_nameDef} was charging! The power disruption has scrambled its cogitator core, and it is going berserk.
LanguageData.MessageCaravanAddingEscortingMech: Auto-adding {MECH_nameDef} to the caravan, since it is escorting {OVERSEER_nameDef}
LanguageData.MessageCaravanRemovingEscortingMech: Auto-removing {MECH_nameDef} from the caravan, since it is escorting {OVERSEER_nameDef}
LanguageData.DesignatorMechControlGroupDesc: Assign the selected servitor(s) to another control group under their current overseer.
LanguageData.RecipeRequiresMechanitor: The recipe {0} requires an overseer to work on it. None of your colonists are overseers, so nobody will do this bill.
LanguageData.LetterMechlinkInstalled:
{PAWN_labelShort} has installed a mechlink! {PAWN_pronoun} is now an overseer and can create and control servitors.

Research basic cybernetica tech to get started.

(*SectionTitle)Creating servitors:(/SectionTitle) Your overseer can create servitors at a production building called a servitor construction bay.

(*SectionTitle)About bandwidth:(/SectionTitle) Overseers can control as many servitors as their total bandwidth allows. Select {PAWN_labelShort} and look at {PAWN_possessive} 'Bandwidth' readout to see how much bandwidth {PAWN_pronoun} is currently using and how much {PAWN_pronoun} has available. Bandwidth can be increased with certain apparel and by building band node buildings.

(*SectionTitle)About control groups:(/SectionTitle) Overseers control servitors in groups. Each control group can be set to one of these modes:

- Work
- Escort
- Recharge
- Dormant self-charge

To change a control group's mode, select any servitor in that group and use the mode buttons in the inspection pane.
LanguageData.LetterBossgroupCallerUnlocked: You can now build a {PARENT_label} which an overseer can use to summon a {LEADER_label}. If you defeat the {LEADER_label}, it will drop the following items:\n\n{REWARDSLIST}
